intro: Echites micranthus, commonly known as the small-flowered echites, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in a rounded head, and it produces small, elongated seeds. Echites micranthus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
